claim.claim-text: 1. A communication apparatus, wherein the apparatus is used in a communication system comprising a first node, at least one second node, and a third node, the first node is an upper-level node of the at least one second node, and the at least one second node is an interference node of the third node; and the apparatus comprises a transceiver and a processor, wherein the transceiver is configured to receive first indication information from the first node, wherein the first indication information comprises first resource information, and the first resource information is associated with a first reference signal; and the processor is configured to determine the first resource information based on the first indication information, wherein the first resource information is for limiting sending of a to-be-sent signal on a first resource indicated by the first resource information.

2. The apparatus according to claim 1, wherein that the first resource information is for limiting sending of a to-be-sent signal on a first resource indicated by the first resource information comprises: the first resource information indicates that the to-be-sent signal is not allowed to be sent on the first resource indicated by the first resource information.

3. The apparatus according to claim 1, wherein that the first resource information is for limiting sending of a to-be-sent signal on a first resource indicated by the first resource information comprises: sending the to-be-sent signal based on the first resource indicated by the first resource information at transmit power less than a threshold; sending the to-be-sent signal based on the first resource indicated by the first resource information at transmit power less than transmit power for sending a second reference signal; or sending the to-be-sent signal based on an offset threshold to transmit power for sending a second reference signal and based on the first resource indicated by the first resource information.

4. The apparatus according to claim 1, wherein the first resource information comprises second indication information, the second indication information indicates that the first reference signal and the to-be-sent signal have a quasi co-location (QCL) relationship, and the quasi co-location (QCL) relationship is for limiting the sending of the to-be-sent signal on the first resource indicated by the first resource information.

5. The apparatus according to claim 1, wherein the first resource information further comprises one or more of the following: first time domain resource information, first frequency domain information, and first space domain resource information.
6. The apparatus according to claim 5, wherein the first space domain resource information comprises one or more of the following: a port identifier and a panel identifier.

7. The apparatus according to claim 5, wherein the first space domain resource information comprises one or more of the following: a peer device identifier of the second node and a transmission link identifier.

8. The apparatus according to claim 7, wherein that the first resource information is associated with a first reference signal comprises one or more of the following: the first resource information is associated with a device corresponding to the first reference signal; and the first resource information is associated with a transmission link corresponding to the first reference signal.

9. The apparatus according to claim 1, wherein the first indication information further comprises a cell identifier and/or a reference signal identifier, and the cell identifier and/or the reference signal identifier are/is for identifying the first reference signal.

10. A communication apparatus, wherein the apparatus is used in a communication system comprising a first node, at least one second node, and a third node, the first node is an upper-level node of the at least one second node, and the at least one second node is an interference node of the third node; and the apparatus comprises a transceiver and a processor, wherein the processor is configured to determine first indication information; and the transceiver is configured to send the first indication information to the at least one second node, wherein the first indication information comprises first resource information, the first resource information is associated with a first reference signal, and the first resource information is for limiting sending of a to-be-sent signal by the at least one second node on a first resource indicated by the first resource information.

11. The apparatus according to claim 10, wherein that the first resource information is for limiting sending of a to-be-sent signal by the at least one second node on a first resource indicated by the first resource information comprises: the first resource information indicates that the at least one second node is not allowed to send the to-be-sent signal on the first resource indicated by the first resource information.

12. The apparatus according to claim 10, wherein that the first resource information is for limiting sending of a to-be-sent signal by the at least one second node on a first resource indicated by the first resource information comprises: sending the to-be-sent signal based on the first resource indicated by the first resource information at transmit power less than a threshold; sending the to-be-sent signal based on the first resource indicated by the first resource information at transmit power less than transmit power for sending a second reference signal; or sending the to-be-sent signal based on an offset threshold to transmit power for sending a second reference signal and based on the first resource indicated by the first resource information.

13. The apparatus according to claim 10, wherein the first resource information comprises second indication information, the second indication information indicates that the first reference signal and the to-be-sent signal have a quasi co-location (QCL) relationship, and the quasi co-location (QCL) relationship is for limiting the sending of the to-be-sent signal by the at least one second node on the first resource indicated by the first resource information.

14. The apparatus according to claim 10, wherein the first resource information further comprises one or more of the following: first time domain resource information, first frequency domain information, and first space domain resource information.
15. The apparatus according to claim 14, wherein the first space domain resource information comprises one or more of the following: a port identifier and a panel identifier.

16. The apparatus according to claim 14, wherein the first space domain resource information comprises one or more of the following: a peer device identifier of the at least one second node and a transmission link identifier.

17. The apparatus according to claim 16, wherein that the first resource information is associated with a first reference signal comprises one or more of the following: the first resource information is associated with a device corresponding to the first reference signal; and the first resource information is associated with a transmission link corresponding to the first reference signal.

18. The apparatus according to claim 10, wherein the first indication information further comprises a cell identifier and/or a reference signal identifier, and the cell identifier and/or the reference signal identifier are/is for identifying the first reference signal.

19. A resource indication method, wherein the method is applied to a communication system comprising a first node, at least one second node, and a third node, the first node is an upper-level node of the at least one second node, and the at least one second node is an interference node of the third node; and the method comprises:receiving, by the second node, first indication information from the first node, wherein the first indication information comprises first resource information, and the first resource information is associated with a first reference signal; anddetermining, by the second node, the first resource information based on the first indication information, wherein the first resource information is for limiting sending of a to-be-sent signal on a first resource indicated by the first resource information.
